item.title: fuzzy hashing
item.description: Fuzzy hashing helps us to perform similarity analysis - match two files with minor differences based on the fuzzy hash values. One of the examples of fuzzy hashing is the usage of SSDeep.

item.title: Phishing Email
item.description: About Your email address has been leaked and you receive an email from Paypal in German. Try to analyze the suspicious email. File location: C:\Users\LetsDefend\Desktop\Files\PhishingChallenge.zip Password: infected This challenge prepared by @Fuuji Walkthroughs: DFIR Challenge - Phishing Email Phishing Email Challenge & Step-by-Step SOC Alert Investigations Phishing Email Challenge by LetsDefend E-mail Analysis - A LetsDefend Challenge Questions What is the return path of the email? â†’ bounce@rjttznyzjjzydnillquh.designclub.uk.com What is the domain name of the url in this mail? â†’ storage.googleapis.com Is the domain mentioned in the previous question suspicious? â†’ yes What is the body SHA-256 of the domain? â†’ 13945ecc33afee74ac7f72e1d5bb73050894356c4bf63d02a1a53e76830567f5 Is this email a phishing email? â†’ Yes Analysis The file contained the copy of email which was sent to us.
